review: PROS:1) Setup was super easy.2) moving it between TV's is super easy3) The UI is great and I can move though the menu without any issues.CONS:1) Needs Netflix integration into search, like Hulu is currently.2) It's not very easy to just search the entire Amazon Prime collection, the recommendations are decent and work, but I want the ability to see every in your collection.3) I lied, recommendation really aren't that good, and it'd be better if I could rate movies I've seen with star rating to make it better.4) Casting doesn't work from my Windows phone or Windows PC. and I have to say THAT ANNOUYS ME TO DEATH!~!!!~! (If this worked it would be a 5+ star product.Overall, for $29 (Prime special pricing) It's great for all of my entertainment needs at home.

review: I was really excited about this fire TV stick to come in the mail, but unfortunately I had some problems with it connecting to my older TV. It continuously flashed green, even when I rebooted it and did all the things that online tech help guided me through. Even when I was able to get it to work with my other TV, one of the main reasons why I bought the stick, for Netflix, was not working, and has yet to start working a month later.
author: Lachelle

review: Don't include my stars in evaluating this product.  Our house was broken in to when we at a relatives Christmas afternoon and these were stolen before getting the box open.  But, I can't find "ask a question here" ......can this connect to a hotel web based internet connection?  We travel a lot, and rather than all of us huddled around our kindles, it makes sense to buy one of these, but only if I can connect by opening a browser to sign in to the internet.  Otherwise, it's no more use for me then my roku 3, in that respect.  Thanks, anyone that can answer this for me :)
author: A. McGill

review: Wow, Amazon shipped this out to me a month earlier than expected. It was a good surprise Xmas present. This is a good device in the early stages. The software does need a bit of work. There needs to be a way to set the sleep timer. Additionally the sleep button needs to be more easily accessible from the main menu. It's currently buried 4 screens down in the settings menu. The interface is very busy, but still easy to navigate... for the Amazon stuff only. Any of the other vendor stuff (YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, etc.) is buried and bit problematic to find. I get that Amazon is promoting their own stuff, but come on.
